FuncDef:
The dhcp coa-zero-lease dual-cut command enables a device to log out a dual-stack user from both IPv4 and IPv6 stacks and send a DHCPv4 NAK message to the user when the RADIUS server delivers a zero lease for the user's IPv4 address in a CoA message and the user sends a Request message to renew the lease.
The undo dhcp coa-zero-lease dual-cut command cancels the configuration.
By default, a device logs out a dual-stack user from only the IPv4 stack and sends a DHCPv4 NAK message to the user when the RADIUS server delivers a zero lease for the user's IPv4 address in a CoA message and the user sends a Request message to renew the lease.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, a device logs out a dual-stack user from only the IPv4 stack and sends a DHCPv4 NAK message to the user when the RADIUS server delivers a zero lease for the user's IPv4 address in a CoA message and the user sends a Request message to renew the lease. To enable the device to logout a dual-stack user from both IPv4 and IPv6 stacks, run the dhcp coa-zero-lease dual-cut command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
